cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 470 miles ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest along or just north of Cuba, then curving northwest toward the Florida Keys/south Florida on Saturday and the Florida Panhandle early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near the Big Bend / Panama City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys from Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas and the southwest coast of Florida from Bonita Beach south and east to Ocean Reef, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North coast of Cuba, Florida Keys and southern Florida, later Florida Panhandle and northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤10%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts Saturday; otherwise breezy conditions
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected on the Atlantic side at PortMiami
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches possible with isolated amounts up to 8 inches, leading to urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches; reduced visibility and lightning within outer rainbands
